meanings.definition: Divide and allocate in proper proportions.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will apportion the candies equally among the students.
meanings.sent2: It is important to apportion the resources fairly among all team members.
meanings.sent3: The elves decided to apportion the cookies based on who had been the nicest.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility to apportion the tasks fell on the team leader.
meanings.sent5: She carefully apportioned the ingredients to make the perfect cake.

meanings.sent1: The company will apportion the profits among its shareholders.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to apportion the workload evenly among team members.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had to apportion the chores fairly to avoid arguments.
meanings.sent4: The captain had to apportion the limited supplies among the crew.
meanings.sent5: He skillfully apportioned the tasks to ensure efficiency.
